CFSU Uplands 475 Systems Upgrade
=====================================

**Government of Canada Tender Notice**
--------------------------------------

### Project Description

This is a procurement opportunity for the upgrade of existing cooling and ventilation systems at CFSU Uplands 475. The scope of work includes modifying the systems to improve their efficiency and functionality. The project also involves the installation of new electrical panels and circuits, cooling units, and ductwork, as well as roof modifications for the condenser units.

### Bidder Requirements

* Hold a valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS) or Facility Security Clearance at level of Reliability Status at contract award.
* Comply with all mandatory security requirements.
* Provide the names, dates of birth, and company representatives for all site visit attendees 24 hours prior to the visit.

### Tender Details

* Bidder Type: Competitive - Open Bidding
* Selection Criteria: Lowest Price
* Tender Status: Expired
* Location: National Capital Region (NCR)
* Expected Contract Start and End Dates: None
* Estimated Cost: $500,001 to $1,000,000

### Procurement Documents

The bid documents can be obtained from the Government Electronic Tendering Service at http://Buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders or by contacting the contracting authority at (343) 552-1375. Amendments, if issued, will be available from the same source.

### Contact Information

* Dale Rudderham, Contracting Authority: [dale.rudderham@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:dale.rudderham@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
* Phone: (343) 552-1375
* Fax: None

### Important Dates

* Tender Closing Date: September 23, 2022, 14:00:00
* Site Visit Date: September 8, 2022, 10:00:00

### Mandatory Documents

It is essential to read the project description, requirements, and all bid documents before submitting a bid. All tender requirements and obligations must be fulfilled according to the requirements outlined in the bid documents. Inquiries must be made in writing and received no later than five calendar days prior to the closing date. All potential site visit attendees must wear personal protective equipment (PPE), including CSA-approved green patch footwear, hard hats, and safety glasses, upon entry to the site.
